definition: to sign/to put one's name to
tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: This is a Valentine from a secret admirer.
sentences.chinese: 这是一位不具名的爱慕者送来的情人节礼物。

sentences.english: They're ghosts," says one publisher, who declined to be named.
sentences.chinese: 它们只是幻影，”一位不愿具名的出版人说。

sentences.english: Yunnan does not wish the manager of hotel of one star class of sign one's name expresses.
sentences.chinese: 云南一位不愿具名的一星级酒店经理表示。

definition: to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
incoming letter/letter from afar/same as 来信
to do as one thinks fit/to handle by taking circumstances into consideration
to act as surety for sb/to be sb's guarantor/to stand bail for sb
